title: Semantic Segmentation: Label Every Pixel
description: A short lesson to help you apply Semantic Segmentation: Label Every Pixel.

hook.text: Detection boxes the dog. Segmentation colors every dog pixel and every grass pixel.

buildup.text: Semantic segmentation assigns a class label to every single pixel in the image.

discovery.text: U-Net uses an encoder-decoder structure with skip connections for precise pixel labels.

twist.text: Semantic segmentation doesn't distinguish instancesâ€”two dogs get the same label.

climax.text: Used in self-driving (road vs sidewalk), medical imaging (tumor vs tissue), and AR filters.
